title: Ticket #6718: Fix spooling of late materialization itemdata
description:
Just before releasing 8.7.9, we discovered that the new item data spooling feature (qmgmt command SendMaterializeData) was leaking memory by creating a new JobFactory object but not adding it to JobFactoriesSubmitPending. The item data was being stored in the JobFactory object and written into the spool directory. When the subsequent SetJobFactory qmgmt command was processed, a second JobFactory object was created (and added to JobFactoriesSubmitPending). Lacking an in-memory copy of the item data, it read the data from disk.

The handler for SendMaterializeData should be adding its JobFactory to JobFactoriesSubmitPending and the handler for SetJobFactory should be using that object instead of creating a new one. But the code for reading the item data from the network directly into the JobFactory object hadn't been tested and it was too close to the release of 8.7.9, so we fixed the leak by deleting the first JobFactory object after the item data was received.

Now, we should replace that quick fix with the real fix and test that it works.
remarks:

This small memory and performance fix doesn't merit a version history entry.
check_ins: 2018-Jul-24 11:43   Check-in [55208]: Fix spooling of late materialization item data. #6718 Don't create and discard a JobFactory object to spool item data over the qmgmt connection. Instead, the item data will be saved in memory as well as written to disk, avoiding the need to re-read the disk copy later. (By Jaime Frey )
